= nopriority =

 function: integer '''nopriority'''();

== Description ==
The '''nopriority''' function cancels active priority procedures for the current DIL program.

== Return Value ==
Returns '''integer''':
* '''0''' - Successfully canceled priority procedures
* '''non-zero''' - Error code if cancellation failed

== Examples ==
 dilbegin reset_priority();
 var
    result : integer;
 code
 {
    priority(SFB_MSG, argument == "admin_reset");
    result := nopriority();
    
    if (result == 0)
    {
       exec("say Priority reset successfully.", self);
    }
 } dilend

 dilbegin emergency_override();
 code
 {
    priority(SFB_MSG, argument == "emergency");
    exec("say Emergency mode active!", self);
    pause;
    nopriority();
    exec("say Emergency mode deactivated.", self);
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The '''nopriority''' function cancels all priority procedures set by [[priority]] function
* Used to reset interrupt handling to default state
* Common in systems that need to temporarily override priority behavior:
** Emergency stop routines
** Administrative override functions
** System reset procedures
* Priority levels determine which DIL program gets control during activation
* Higher priority numbers take precedence over lower ones

== Error Handling ==
* Returns '''0''' on successful cancellation
* Returns '''non-zero''' error code if cancellation fails
* The function itself does not validate parameters - errors come from the underlying priority system

== Related Functions/Fields ==
* [[priority]] - Set priority for activation interrupts
* [[interrupt]] - Set up interrupt handling for specific message classes
* [[clear]] - Clear specific interrupt handlers
* [[on_activation]] - Handle activation-time interrupts
